topic: How to unit test microservices using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to unit test microservices using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Unit Testing Microservices with FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: Learn how to write and execute tests for your FastAPI microservices using Python 3.12+ and its built-in testing tools.
key_points: Understand the basics of FastAPI and its test client
Use pytest as the testing framework
Set up a minimal test structure for your FastAPI endpoints
Test both happy paths and edge cases in your microservices
Leverage the built-in features of Python 3.12+ to improve testing efficiency

code_examples.code:
def test_get_items():
    client = TestClient(app)
    response = client.get('/items/')
    assert response.status_code == 200

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required to use the new features of the built-in async syntax and improvements in type hints.
FastAPI version >= 0.65.0 is recommended for improved testing capabilities
caveats: While FastAPI provides a comprehensive set of testing tools, you may still need additional libraries to handle specific testing scenarios
Remember to mock dependencies like databases and external APIs during tests to isolate the microservice under test
